tika.dc.description:
<p>Written by a renowned Oxford historian, this fascinating volume presents a global history of truth. Sharp and authoritative, <i>Truth</i> manages to touch every period of human experience; it leaps from truth-telling technologies of "primitive" societies to the private mental worlds of great philosophers; from spiritualism to science and from New York to New Guinea. In clear, lucid prose, this little book takes on an enormous subject and makes it understandable to anyone.</p><p>
</p><p>
</p>
